results.title: Understanding A.D.D.: Attention Deficit Disorder
results.creator_credit: Australian Video Publishers and Bryan Lowe
results.brief_description: Dr. Christopher Green, author of the famous “Toddler taming” and “Babies”, is a leading authority on Attention Deficit Disorder. This program, designed for parents, teachers and healthcare professionals, investigates key issues about the disorder. It profiles the causes of ADD, behaviours associated with the condition, diagnosis, treatment, medication, adult manifestations of the condition and includes a segment with questions from the audience.

results.title: Understanding
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is Part Nine of a twelve episode documentary, The Heart of the Dragon. The documentary records what is actually happening in China today and it captures on film the lives of peasants, factory workers, Party officials, artists, scientists, and even millionaires.

results.title: Understandably depressed
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Hidden depths”.
Depression is a state where nothing outside is of any interest any longer (Ruley) “It’s like not feeling quite alive” What exactly is depression? Is it a physical illness or a state of mind? What are the symptoms of depression? Are some people or families more prone to depression than others? Does medication help, or merely prolong the cure? Using the experiences of two depressives, Ruley and John and the opinions of clinical psychologist, Professor David Smail and GP, Dr. Brian Harris, this program attempts to provide some answers on this condition which can affect up to one in four people at some time in their lives.

results.title: Underground water
results.creator_credit: Forum Australia, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Roland Beckett
results.brief_description: The importance of underground water in Australia. Indicates the extent to which the cattle country relies on bore water and the work being done by geologists and hydrographers in the field, and the scientists in laboratories, on the problem of desalination.

results.title: Underground film
results.brief_description: A study of the underground film movement, and independent filmmakers, as exemplified by Chick Strand and her work. Presents examples of underground films and from Strand’s award winning film ‘Anselmo’ to demonstrate the experimental and improvisational nature of this art form. Shows the distribution and presentation of underground films in the US. Strand’s partner is also shown working on the cover art for Frank Zappa’s the Mothers of Invention album ‘Weasels Ripped my Flesh’. Music by Jason and Spencer.

results.title: Underground
results.creator_credit: Pierre Spengler, CiBy 2000, Pandora Films, Novo Film and Emir Kusturica
results.brief_description:
An epic, wild, extremely black tragi-comedy, ‘Underground’ traces the war torn history of Yugoslavia from World War II to Bosnia. The story focuses on two friends, Marco and Blacky, and their absurd misadventures over the fifty years. The characters in this film inhabit a world of self-delusion, deceit and abuse, but also of revelry, vitality and love. Kusturica’s blend of lush surrealism, wistful fantasy and dark irony, perfectly juxtapose both the hilarity and intense drama of this tale of townsfolk who, in an effort to escape the brutality of war go underground. It is both an historical documentation of the complexities of Yugoslavian politics, as well as an absurdly dark fairytale of unpredictable proportions about the absurdity of war.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Spengler ; director, Emir Kusturica ; writer, Dusan Kovacevic ; photography, Vilko Filac ; music, Goran Bregovic ; editing, Branka Ceperac.
Cast: Miki Manojlovic, Lazar Ristovski, Slavko Stimac, Srdjan Todorovic, Pierre Spengler, Branko Cvejic.

results.title: Underground
results.creator_credit: Pierre Spengler, CiBy 2000, Novo Film, Pandora Films and Emir Kusturica
results.brief_description: An epic, wild, extremely black tragi-comedy, “Underground” traces the war torn history of Yugoslavia from World War II to Bosnia. The story focuses on two friends, Marco and Blacky, and their absurd misadventures over the last 50 years. Based on Dusan Kovacevic’s story “Once upon a time there was a country”, the characters in this film inhabit a world of self-delusion, deceit and abuse, but also of revelry, vitality and love. Kusturica’s blend of lush surrealism, wistful fantasy and dark irony, perfectly juxtapose both the hilarity and intense drama of this tale of townsfolk who, in an effort to escape the brutality of war go underground. It is both an historical documentation of the complexities of Yugoslavian politics, as well as an absurdly dark fairytale of unpredictable proportions about the absurdity of war. In Serbo-Croatian with English subtitles.

results.title: Underdog
results.creator_credit: Robert Colvin, Illumination Films (AU) and Paul Cox
results.brief_description: The dingo is currently hunted as a pest in all states of Australia, and its survival as a pure breed is endangered. This documentary presents a case for the dingo’s protection. It looks at the history of the dingo, its relationship with Australian Aborigines, and at the current dingo erradication program. Interviews people who are involved with the conservation of dingoes, including people who keep them as pets. This is another early film from renowned Australian filmmaker, Paul Cox.
